trustfund: TF037554-VIETNAM - RURAL TRANSPORT,TF034859-VIETNAM - RURAL TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF029169-PHRD-RURAL TRANSPORT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Rural Transport
            Project is rated as satisfactory, sustainability as likely,
            institutional development impact as modest, Bank performance
            as satisfactory, and borrower performance as satisfactory.
            The project demonstrates that rural development projects
            with many small contracts processed at local levels can be
            successfully implemented in Vietnam. This is an important
            finding for the World Bank portfolio, which has shown a
            trend towards decentralized execution of small contracts.
            The project has also demonstrated that if the implementing
            arrangements and processing requirements are made very
            explicit in the Operations Manual and are disseminated
            adequately at the beginning of the implementation, the
            implementing parties will follow closely what is required.
            In Vietnam, technical standards should be established first
            and included in the design and bidding documents and ensured
            through site inspections. With limited resources, there is
            always a trade-off between adoption of high technical
            standards and the need to cover more with lower standards
            and related costs. Upfront efforts should be directed at
            building ownership of design standards by government and
            beneficiaries. The lack of systematic traffic data
            collection in Vietnam hampers the ability to readily monitor
            the impact of the project and inhibits prioritization and
            identification of necessary interventions on roads.
